channel.title: [317] [PI] Summoning Pouch/Scroll Creation
channel.description:
So I have been working on my project for awhile now and I decided to try and add summoning. I started trying with the interface but that didn't work out because the pouch icons were not showing up so I tried going around that and doing it via dialoguehandler and clicking buttons (kinda dumb I know). I have all the pouches with the options and actions set up but I don't know how to make it so when you click the option, it checks your inventory for the items and if you have the items, make the pouch.
Example -
[IMG]http://i61.tinypic.com/1073oll.png[/img] Player clicks "Lava titan pouch"
If the player has "1 blue charm, 1 obsidian charm, 219 shards, and 1 pouch" then make the pouch and remove the items If the player does not have those items, close all windows and output "You need 1 blue charm, 1 obsidian charm, 219 shards, and 1 pouch to make this pouch"
I have been over this and thought about it multiple times, but I have no idea how to check for this and then make the pouch accordingly. Can someone put me in the right direction?

item.title: [317] [PI] Summoning Pouch/Scroll Creation
item.dc:creator: @DerpaDerpy DerpaDerpy

@DerpaDerpy wrote:

sk8rdude461:

What part of the enum are you having an issue with exactly?

item.title: [317] [PI] Summoning Pouch/Scroll Creation
item.dc:creator: @DerpaDerpy DerpaDerpy
item.description:
@DerpaDerpy wrote:

I’m trying to complete summoning on my server and I’m almost done except for this one small part. I want to make scroll creation, but I need an easier way.

I started off storing all the information like this:

public static final String[][] summoningPouchData = { // Pouch id, pouch charm, item1, Shardamount, LVL, Spec scroll { "Spirit wolf pouch", "Gold Charm", "Wolf bones", "7", "1", "Howl scroll", "5" }, { "Dreadfowl pouch", "Gold Charm", "Raw chicken", "8", "4", "Dreadfowl strike scroll", "9" },
The list is complete, but I’m only showing two for an example. I want to make it so when you use a certain pouch on the npc, it creates the scrolls according to what pouch you use.
I was thinking somewhere along the lines of storing all the pouch id’s in an enum, but then after that part, I don’t know where to go. Can someone help?

Read full topic

item.title: [317] [PI] Summoning Pouch/Scroll Creation
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

if(c.dialogueId = THE_DIALOGUE_ID) {// If they clicked the summon dialogue if(c.getItems().playerHasItem(BLUE_CHARM_ID, 1) && c.getItems().playerHasItem(OBSIDIAN_CHARM_ID, 1) && c.getItems().playerHasItem(SHARD_ID, 219) && c.getItems().playerHasItem(POUCH_ID, 1) {// Checks if player has items // Do stuff in here, they have items } else { // They don't have the items } }

There are much better ways you can check items and etc, but that is just an example.

One way you could do this is store all the summoning data into something like an enum. Store how many pouches are needed, charms, and etc.
Then, in your summoning class, create an array of integers that are used for the dialogue ids…
Now, create a method that requires the dialogue id and the action button id as parameters.
First, you need to check if the dialogue id is the correct. so create a for loop to check that.
Second, you will need to grab the summoning data based on the action button clicked and dialogue id… This is going to be handled in a second method that returns the summoning object (or null if none).
Third, you need to check if the player has all the items… It’d be similar to how I showed above, but instead of specifying specific IDs, you’d just use the values from the summoning data.
Fourth, check the player level.
If all that’s good, delete the items, give the player the items, and give them exp.

Read full topic
